metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3631 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The assoc_array_gc function in the associative-array implementation in lib/assoc_array.c in the Linux kernel before 3.16.3 does not properly implement garbage collection, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and system crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via multiple "keyctl newring" operations followed by a "keyctl timeout" operation. A flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's associative-array garbage collection implementation. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly have other unspecified impact by using keyctl operations.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3631` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-37-generic - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-3.13.0-37-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-3.13.0-37-lowlatency - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-3.13.0-37-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-3.13.0-37-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-3.13.0-37-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-3.13.0-37-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-3.13.0-37-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-37-generic - 3.13.0-37.64
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.04 preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-37.64').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-37.64').
